Title: Can ChatGPT Make This Podcast?
Paragraph: OpenAI’s new chatbot is a coder, a teacher, a potential Google killer, and … a friend?
Author: KEVIN ROOSE, CASEY NEWTON, DAVIS LAND, PAULA SZUCHMAN, DAN POWELL, ELISHEBA ITTOOP, ROWAN NIEMISTO and ALYSSA MOXLEY

Title: Apple Details Plans to Beef Up Encryption of Data in Its iCloud
Paragraph: The move could frustrate law enforcement efforts to circumvent the already tough security of iPhones.
Author: TRIPP MICKLE

Title: Why Losing to Meta in Court May Still Be a Win for Regulators
Paragraph: As the Federal Trade Commission prepares to face off in court against Meta over a V.R. start-up deal, the agency is testing a novel argument as part of a strategy to push antitrust law.
Author: DAVID MCCABE

Title: Twitter’s Rivals Try to Capitalize on Musk-Induced Chaos
Paragraph: New start-ups and other social platforms sense opportunity as Twitter grapples with changes from Elon Musk, its new owner.
Author: KALLEY HUANG

Title: Microsoft to Offer Call of Duty on Nintendo Devices if Activision Deal Closes
Paragraph: The move appears to be an olive branch to the Federal Trade Commission, which could vote to block the $69 billion acquisition in a closed-door session on Thursday.
Author: KAREN WEISE and KELLEN BROWNING

Title: Apple Expands Pricing for Apps
Paragraph: At a time of rising inflation, the company is introducing 600 options that could free developers from the days of charging 99 cents.
Author: TRIPP MICKLE

Title: Oversight Board Criticizes Meta for Preferential Treatment
Paragraph: Influential and powerful users on Facebook and Instagram receive “unequal treatment,” an internal report said.
Author: ADAM SATARIANO and SHEERA FRENKEL

Title: Computer Science Students Face a Shrinking Big Tech Job Market
Paragraph: A new reality is setting in for students and recent graduates who spent years honing themselves for careers at the largest tech companies.
Author: NATASHA SINGER and KALLEY HUANG

Title: Inside the Face-Off Between Russia and a Small Internet Access Firm
Paragraph: The cat-and-mouse experience of Proton, a Swiss company, shows what it’s like to be targeted by Russian censors — and what it takes to fight back.
Author: ADAM SATARIANO and PAUL MOZUR

Title: Are You Applying for Tech Jobs or Internships? We Want to Hear About It.
Paragraph: Layoffs and hiring freezes at companies like Amazon and Meta are changing the job market for recent grads and college students. Tell us about your experiences.
Author: NATASHA SINGER
